hints_html: Here the square multiply algorithm might be the best approach.
hints_latex: Here the square multiply algorithm might be the best approach.
hints_raw: Here the square multiply algorithm might be the best approach.
question: 3 (b)
sols_html:
We use the square multiply algorithm to solve this problem. We compute \(\displaystyle 9^{2a}\) for a up to 4 to compute this value. We see that

\[\begin{aligned} 9 &\equiv 9 \mod{31}\\ 9^{2} &\equiv 81 \equiv 19 \mod{31} \\ 9^{4} &\equiv (9^{2})^{2} \equiv 19^{2} \equiv 361 \equiv 51 \equiv 20 \mod{31} \\ 9^{8} &\equiv (9^{4})^{2} \equiv 20^{2} \equiv 400 \equiv 90 \equiv 28 \equiv -3 \mod{31} \\ 9^{16} &\equiv (9^{8})^{2} \equiv (-3)^{2} \equiv 9 \mod{31}\end{aligned}\]

Now, we have that

\[\begin{aligned} 9^{23} &\equiv 9^{16}\cdot 9^{4} \cdot 9^{2} \cdot 9^{1} \mod{31}\\ &\equiv 9 \cdot 20 \cdot 19 \cdot 9 \mod{31}\\ &\equiv 9 \cdot 9 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\ &\equiv 9^{2} \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\ &\equiv 19 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\ &\equiv 19^{2} \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\ &\equiv 20 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\ &\equiv 28 \mod{31}\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
We use the square multiply algorithm to solve this problem. We compute
$\displaystyle 9^{2a}$ for \emph{a} up to 4 to compute this value. We
see that

\begin{align*}
9 &\equiv 9 \mod{31}\\
9^{2} &\equiv 81 \equiv 19 \mod{31} \\
9^{4} &\equiv (9^{2})^{2} \equiv 19^{2} \equiv 361 \equiv 51 \equiv 20 \mod{31} \\
9^{8} &\equiv (9^{4})^{2} \equiv 20^{2} \equiv 400 \equiv 90 \equiv 28 \equiv -3 \mod{31} \\
9^{16} &\equiv (9^{8})^{2} \equiv (-3)^{2} \equiv 9 \mod{31}
\end{align*}

Now, we have that

\begin{align*}
9^{23} &\equiv 9^{16}\cdot 9^{4} \cdot 9^{2} \cdot 9^{1} \mod{31}\\
&\equiv 9 \cdot 20 \cdot 19 \cdot 9 \mod{31}\\
&\equiv 9 \cdot 9 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 9^{2} \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 19 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 19^{2} \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 20 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 28 \mod{31}
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
We use the square multiply algorithm to solve this problem. We compute <math> \displaystyle 9^{2a}</math> for ''a'' up to 4 to compute this value. We see that

<math> \displaystyle 
\begin{align}
9 &\equiv 9 \mod{31}\\
9^{2} &\equiv 81 \equiv 19 \mod{31} \\
9^{4} &\equiv (9^{2})^{2} \equiv 19^{2} \equiv 361 \equiv 51 \equiv 20 \mod{31} \\
9^{8} &\equiv (9^{4})^{2} \equiv 20^{2} \equiv 400 \equiv 90 \equiv 28 \equiv -3 \mod{31} \\
9^{16} &\equiv (9^{8})^{2} \equiv (-3)^{2} \equiv 9 \mod{31}
\end{align}
</math>

Now, we have that 

<math> \displaystyle 
\begin{align}
9^{23} &\equiv 9^{16}\cdot 9^{4} \cdot 9^{2} \cdot 9^{1} \mod{31}\\
&\equiv 9 \cdot 20 \cdot 19 \cdot 9 \mod{31}\\
&\equiv 9 \cdot 9 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 9^{2} \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 19 \cdot 19 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 19^{2} \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 20 \cdot 20 \mod{31} \\
&\equiv 28 \mod{31}
\end{align}
</math>
